insights.insight_statement: Users with administrative privileges have a different experience than regular users, leading to insights about potential usability issues.
insights.supporting_evidence: David mentioned, 'I had more problems with the phone app than I did with the computer based web application.'
insights.why_it_matters: Understanding the disparity in experiences can inform design decisions to cater to both administrative and regular users, ensuring that functionalities meet the needs of all user types.

insights.insight_statement: The mobile app is perceived as underpowered and creates confusion among users.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...I felt it was underpowered and gave conflicting information.'
insights.why_it_matters: Improving the mobile app's functionality could enhance user satisfaction and reduce frustration, particularly among users who primarily rely on mobile devices.

insights.insight_statement: Users value clarity and transparency in event information but find descriptions often lacking.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...event descriptions and especially save the date kinds of things or conflicting scheduling things were not as transparent or not as clear...'
insights.why_it_matters: Enhancing the clarity of event information could improve user engagement and event participation, as users are more likely to attend events they clearly understand.

insights.insight_statement: There is a significant knowledge gap in the training and onboarding process for new committee members.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...the training process really needs to have some hard, hard look at two issues... the venue for training has been woefully inadequate.'
insights.why_it_matters: Addressing this gap can enable new members to effectively use the system, thereby improving overall event management and user experience.

insights.insight_statement: Institutional memory is lacking, leading to repeated learning curves for new members.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...the lack of a formalized institutional memory... there’s not a facile way to have some kind of archival process...'
insights.why_it_matters: Creating a system for preserving institutional knowledge can smooth transitions and maintain continuity, benefiting both new and returning members.

insights.insight_statement: Printed name tags serve a dual purpose of identification and as an audit function for event registration.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...if I saw anyone walking around with a name tag that was a pencil, sharpie, handwritten name tag rather than a printed name tag... that was a clue that that person may not have been registered...'
insights.why_it_matters: Incorporating printed name tags can enhance event organization and registration verification, contributing to a smoother attendee experience.

insights.insight_statement: Users prioritize utility over aesthetics in website design.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...I want to do my business and I want to get out. And so from that perspective, cleaner, simpler, better is my approach.'
insights.why_it_matters: Focusing on utility in design can lead to increased user satisfaction and more efficient interactions with the website.

insights.insight_statement: There is a demand for a dedicated technical support role to assist with event management.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...there ought to be a paid technical kind of person that really could be there, you know, as the glue to hold together...'
insights.why_it_matters: Implementing a dedicated support role could relieve administrative burdens from committee members and improve event execution.

insights.insight_statement: The organization experiences high turnover, affecting continuity and event planning.
insights.supporting_evidence: '...it reinvents itself every six months... the learning curve just hits the peak at the time of transition.'
insights.why_it_matters: A strategy to address turnover, such as extending terms or improving training, could enhance the stability and effectiveness of event planning.
